attributes.additional_details:
Battle of Hastings - percentage wise a lesser number of foreign people settled in Britain than are here today and this is historically defined as the last time Britain was invaded.

Multi-culturalism - sounds righteous on paper.

The EU was set up after WW2 “to keep peace and sustain trade”. I would like you to bear in mind pre WW1 the UK’s biggest trader was Germany; this still resulted in war. Trade agreements can be made in writing; they do not require unelected commissioners to run a parliament which a CONTINENT undemocratically elects.

5th century, the Romans became liberal in their politics. Threatened by barbarians they began to invite leaders to Rome to allow them to experience the Roman life. The barbarians didn’t follow this and exploited what they knew and sacked them.

Isn’t that what is happening now? Forced to bend to other wills?

Each year the EU puts us further into debt when we are a poor, would you take out more loans to pay for debt?
